member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.CompositionProvider
member.summary: Provides composition services to ASP.NET MVC by integrating DependencyResolver with the Managed Extensibility Framework (MEF). This class is self-configuring and will be enabled by simply being present in the application's Bin directory. Most applications should not need to access this class.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.CompositionProvider.SetConfiguration(System.ComponentModel.Composition.Lightweight.Hosting.ContainerConfiguration)
member.summary: Used to override the default conventions for controller/part dependency injection. Cannot be used in conjunction with any other methods on this type. Most applications should not use this method.
member.param: A configuration containing the controller types and other parts that should be used by the composition provider.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.CompositionProvider.AddAssemblies(System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary: Adds assemblies containing MEF parts to the composition provider. Part types should be in namespaces that include a ".Parts" element in their name in order to be discovered and used.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.CompositionProvider.AddAssemblies(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly})
member.summary: Adds assemblies containing MEF parts to the composition provider. Part types should be in namespaces that include a ".Parts" element in their name in order to be discovered and used.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.CompositionProvider.AddAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Adds an assembly containing MEF parts to the composition provider. Part types should be in namespaces that include a ".Parts" element in their name in order to be discovered and used.
member.param: An assembly containing parts to add.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.ExportModelBinderAttribute
member.summary: Marks a type as being a model binder for a specified model type. The type decorated with this attribute must implement the interface.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.ExportModelBinderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Construct an instance of the .
member.param: The model type bound by the model binder.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Internal.RequestScopeFactory
member.summary: Composition root for the MVC integration, do not call directly.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Internal.RequestScopeFactory.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.Composition.ExportFactory{System.ComponentModel.Composition.IExportProvider})
member.summary: For internal use.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Boundaries
member.summary: Well-known sharing boundary names. The composition provider uses all of these when handling a web request.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Boundaries.HttpRequest
member.summary: The boundary within which a current HTTP request is accessible.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Boundaries.DataConsistency
member.summary: The boundary within which a consistent view of persistent data is available.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.Boundaries.UserIdentity
member.summary: The boundary within which a single user can be identified.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.MvcContainerConfiguration
member.summary: A that loads parts in the currently-executing ASP.NET MVC web application. Parts are detected by namespace - classes in a ".Parts" namespace will be considered to be parts. These classes, and any interfaces they implement, will be exported and shared on a per-HTTP-request basis. When resolving dependencies, the longest public constructor on a part type will be used. The , and associated MEF attributes can be applied to modify composition structure.
member.remarks: This implementation emulates CompositionContainer and the composition-container based MVC integration for all types under the Parts namespace, for controllers, and for model binders. This will aid migration from one composition engine to the other, but this decision should be revisited if it causes confusion.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.MvcContainerConfiguration.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly})
member.summary: Construct an using parts in the specified assemblies.
member.param: Assemblies in which to search for parts.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.MvcContainerConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Construct an using parts in the main application assembly. In some applications this may not be the expected assembly - in those cases specify the assemblies explicitly using the other constructor.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.RequestCompositionScopeModule
member.summary: Provides lifetime management for the type. This module is automatically injected into the ASP.NET request processing pipeline at startup and should not be called by user code.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.RequestCompositionScopeModule.Register
member.summary: Register the module. This method is automatically called at startup and should not be called by user code.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.RequestCompositionScopeModule.Dispose
member.summary: Release resources used by the module.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Web.Mvc.RequestCompositionScopeModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Initialize the module.
member.param: Application in which the module is running.
